alert.note: Alert for Bayfield; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 2:42AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Bayfield, northeastern Washburn and northwestern Sawyer Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 242 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Seeley, to near Cable, to near Round Lake, to near Chief Lake on Chippewa Flowage, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cable around 245 AM CDT. Chippewa Flowage East around 250 AM CDT. Drummond around 255 AM CDT. Iron River, Benoit, Town of Delta and Namekagon around 310 AM CDT. Namekagon Lake and Ino around 315 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Reserve, Northwoods Beach, Chief Lake, Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation, Totagatic Lake, Lost Land Lake, Middle Eau Claire Lake, Grindstone Lake, Teal Lake and Nelson Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
